index.title: Search - Consensus - Evidence-Based Answers, Faster
index.description: Consensus is a search engine that uses AI to find answers in scientific research.
index.subtitle: Ask a question, get conclusions from research papers

question.title: How to search?
question.text: Consensus uses AI to find answers in research papers. The best way to search is to ask a question.

topics.title: Answers on any research topic
topics.text: Focus on questions that researchers may have studied. See example topics below ranging from biology to social sciences

search.title: Consensus findings for
search.description: Find out what the research says about '{query}'

subtitle.second-paragraph: are covid vaccines effective against delta?

search.share-title: Share what the science says about this query
search.try-yes-no-desc: To unlock the Consensus Meter, ask a yes or no question.

details.description: Consensus used AI to extract this finding from '{paper title}'
details.empty-journal-name: Journal name not available for this finding

nosearchresult.first-title: Sorry, there were no findings related to your search.
nosearchresult.description: If there are specific fields or topics you think we should add to Consensus search, please let us know at

notfound.title: Uh oh. Page not found.
notfound.description:
If you are in the Beta program, try searching!
If not, please go back to the Consensus home page to sign up or learn more.

servererror.oops: Oops. There's a temporary problem with Consensus.
servererror.description: We are still in Beta, so this could happen from time to time. Please retry or give us a few moments to resolve the issue.
servererror.title: Error - Consensus - Evidence-Based Answers, Faster

findingmissing.title: Uh oh. This scientific finding is missing.
findingmissing.description: It may have moved locations, so please try searching for something similar.

loadingsearchresult.first:
Extracting findings
from 200 million scholarly documents
loadingsearchresult.second:
Extracting authors' findings
based on the evidence
loadingsearchresult.third:
Surfacing the best results
for your search

sign-in.sign-in-first-desc: Please sign in to search! No account yet? Sign Up
sign-in.sign-in-first-beta: We are still in Beta. If you aren’t in the Beta program yet, sign up for the waitlist here.
sign-in.message-title: Why do I need an account?
sign-in.message-1: Now, we need to understand how people use Consensus in order to make it better
sign-in.message-2: In the future, your Consensus account will control settings for new features we are working on
sign-in.message-title-2: Consensus will NEVER share your data!
sign-in.message-desc: Unlike other search engines, all user data is 100% anonymized and your searches won't follow you around the Web
sign-in.title: Sign In - Consensus - Evidence-Based Answers, Faster
sign-in.description: Sign in to search! Consensus is a search engine that uses AI to find answers in scientific research.

sign-up.verify-message: If you cannot find the verification email, check your promotions or spam folders. Reach out to SUPPORT_EMAIL for any issues.
sign-up.title: Sign Up - Consensus - Evidence-Based Answers, Faster
sign-up.description: Sign up for free! Consensus is a search engine that uses AI to find answers in scientific research.

too-many-requests.description: You've viewed the maximum page views allowed without logging in. This helps us keep our site speedy for everyone. Thanks for understanding!
too-many-requests.message-auth: Sorry, you have exceeded acceptable use.
too-many-requests.description-auth: If you think this is a mistake and you are using Consensus properly, please contact SUPPORT_EMAIL
too-many-requests.description-auth2: If you think this is a mistake and you are using Consensus properly, please contact SUPPORT_EMAIL
too-many-requests.title: Error - Consensus - Evidence-Based Answers, Faster

pricing.title: Consensus Pricing
pricing.description: Upgrade to streamline your research with all Consensus has to offer.
pricing.page-title: Affordable Plans for Intuitive & Reliable Research
pricing.page-subtitle: Upgrade to take full advantage of AI-powered features and all Consensus has to offer

subscription.page-subtitle: View your subscription status, premium feature usage, payment details, and explore different plans.

cancel-confirm-modal.title: Are you sure you would like to cancel your subscription to Consensus Premium?
cancel-confirm-modal.title-lose-access: You will lose access to the following:
cancel-confirm-modal.text1: Consensus is still very young and your support helps us grow.
cancel-confirm-modal.text2: To suggest improvements to the subscription product, email:

resume-confirm-modal.title: Would you like to resume your subscription?

update-email.title: Update Email
update-email.description: Generate customer portal link to allow users to edit their email.
update-email.success:
Email sent! Please check your email again and follow the instructions to link your Stripe payment to your Consensus account.
If you have any questions, contact {email} for help.
update-email.fail: Failed to send link. Please confirm your email address is correct and Please refresh the page to try again.
update-email.email-body:
Please click this link to update your email address in Stripe to match the email address of your Consensus account.
If you aren't sure what email address is associated with your Consensus account, you can create a new Consensus account using this email, or contact {email} for help.

bookmark-list-detail.title: {list-title} - Lists - Consensus
bookmark-list-detail.empty-message:
You are not the owner of this list.
Please create your own list to view your saved bookmarks.

empty-state.title: You did not save anything yet
empty-state.query-text: does remote patient monitoring improve outcomes?

score.title: Claim Confidence Score
score.content: Consensus uses information from the claim, paper, study design, journal, and more to estimate the credibility of a claim. Our process is based on the latest research in metascience, but the technology is young so please allow time for us to refine this feature

help.title: Improve Your Consensus Experience
help.add-to-home-desc: Save Consensus like a mobile app

disputed.title: Claim Disputed
disputed.content: We detected a potential issue with this claim. {reason} Please review additional relevant findings in Consensus, or see the link below for high quality research addressing this topic.

rigorous-journal.title: This issue ranked in the top {value}% of journals measured by SciScore
rigorous-journal.content: The SciScore Rigor and Transparency Index scores thousands of journals on specific scientific rigor criteria, such as randomization, blinding, and statistical power

highly-cited.title: This paper is in the top 5% of most cited papers in our database.
highly-cited.result-title: From a paper in the top 5% of most cited papers in our database.
highly-cited.content: Having lots of citations does not necessarily mean the finding is more valid, but it is an indicator of a paper's influence.

case-study.title: Case Report
case-study.content: A case report is a paper that describes an individual case or subject (n = 1). While case reports can be useful anecdotes to justify further research, findings should not be generalized.

rct.title: RCT
rct.content: A randomized controlled trial is a study where participants are randomly assigned to the control or the experimental group. RCTs are considered the gold-standard for experimental design.

meta-analysis.title: Meta-analysis
meta-analysis.content: A meta-analysis is a statistical analysis that combines data from many studies in order to reduce the error of any one study. While often considered high quality evidence, it is still subject to the quality of the underlying studies.

systematic-review.title: Systematic Review
systematic-review.content: A systematic review is a summary of the scientific literature related to a specific question. Only studies that meet a specific selection criteria are included in the review, allowing authors to draw conclusions relevant to the research question.

meter.title: Consensus Meter
meter.content: The Consensus Meter attempts to classify the most relevant findings based on how they would answer your question. The maximum # of papers we can analyze is 20, so we may be missing important research.
meter.warning:
Our current model is only 90% accurate and may miss important context.

Please read the papers, consult additional trusted sources, and do not use the meter to make big life decisions.

summary.title: Summary
summary.content: The Summary feature attempts to synthesize the most relevant findings in Consensus into a single sentence that answers your question. We can only analyze up to 10 papers at a time, so we may be missing important research.
summary.warning:
This feature is powered by a generative AI model, and may generate incorrect information.

Please read the papers, consult additional trusted sources, and do not use the summary to make big life decisions.

enhanced.content: Consensus used AI to add missing context from the paper to this finding.

unlocked.description: Enable to have our AI read several papers and synthesize the findings.

bookmark-premium-tooltip.limited-list-description: Sorry, the Free plan only comes with 1 Custom list. If you want unlimited - upgrade your plan!
bookmark-premium-tooltip.limited-items-description: Sorry, the Free Plan only comes with 10 Bookmarks. If you want unlimited - upgrade your plan!

more-results.title: Less relevant results
more-results.content: The following results may not be directly related to your search, but may still be helpful.

non-rct-trial.title: Non-RCT Trial
non-rct-trial.content: A non-RCT trial is an experiment that is either not randomized or not controlled. While these studies can still be well-designed, they may not hold as much weight as true RCTs.

observational-study.title: Observational Study
observational-study.content: An observational study is when researchers observe the effects of a variable that they did not introduce. While these studies can be informative with large samples, they are not considered as useful as experiments for determining causality.

literature-review.title: Literature Review
literature-review.content: A literature review is a summary of the available academic literature related to a topic. While these reviews are able to synthesize insights across many papers, they may not have a rigorous of selection criteria like Systematic Reviews.

animal-trial.title: Animal Trial
animal-trial.content: An animal trial is an experiment conducted on animal subjects rather than humans. Animal trials are an important step to verify the safety of interventions, but human trials are needed to confirm the conclusions are applicable to people.

in-vitro-trial.title: In Vitro Trial
in-vitro-trial.content: An in vitro trial is an experiment conducted outside of a living organism (in a test tube, petri dish, etc.). Experiments in live organisms are required to confirm if the results, but in vitro trials can help decide if further research is warranted.

large-human-trial.title: Large Human Trial
content: Our AI detected that this paper:
The conclusions may be broadly applicable to relevant human populations.

sjr-quartiles.title: SJR Quartiles
sjr-quartiles.content: Scimago Journal Rank measures the influence of journals within a domain. Scores are divided into quartiles, with Q1 being the most influential and Q4 being the least.
sjr-quartiles.footer: Note: We do not have SJR mapped to every paper

study-details.title: Study Snapshot
study-details.content: Consensus uses AI to extract key information about a study's methods

study-details-filter.title: Study Details
study-details-filter.content: Consensus uses AI to extract key information about a study's methods
study-details-filter.footer: Note: We do not have these values for every paper

study-types.title: Study Types
study-types.content: Consensus uses AI to classify the type of study design used. The badge colors map to regions of the generally accepted pyramid of evidence and the associated study types
study-types.footer: Note: We do not have this value for every paper

beta.first-text: Consensus results are not meant to be taken as final truth, but rather, as a reflection of relevant research.
beta.second-text: Science is complex and interpreting results requires nuanced understanding. Please do your due diligence when using this early version. Your engagement and feedback will only make it better!

error.unregistered-beta: Sorry, it looks like the email you entered is not part of the Beta program just yet.
error.couldnt-find-account: Couldn't find your account. Make sure you entered the right email or Sign Up first

waitlist.subtitle: Evidence-based answers, faster
waitlist.description: Want more research-backed insights like these? Join the Consensus Beta waitlist!
waitlist.description-sign-up: Want more research-backed insights like these? Sign up to search
waitlist.already: Already invited from the waitlist? Please
waitlist.success: Thank you! You'll be off the waitlist soon. Follow us on Twitter for updates

incomplete.try-asking: Try asking a well-researched question in the format 'Does x cause y?'
incomplete.eg: E.g. Does beta alanine improve exercise performance?
incomplete.needs-at-least-5: The meter needs at least 5 yes/no predictions to display. Try asking a popular research question.

skipped.explanation: Our models detected a potentially complicated question and are not yet accurate enough to provide a definitive answer. We are working to handle this in the future, but for now, please try another question.

feature-limit.explanation: You have used all of your free Consensus Meters for the month.

meter.disputed: A significant portion of the findings in this analysis have been disputed
meter.disputed-tooltip: We detected a significant number of disputed results in this analysis. The Consensus Meter and Summary are still in Beta, so please do not take the results too seriously. Continue to rely on trusted sources of scientific information for important questions.
meter.error-desc: The Consensus Meter is still in Beta, so this may happen occasionally. Please try again later.

beta.first: These features are in Beta and not 100% accurate.

is-not-question.try-asking: To use the Consensus Meter, try asking a simple Yes/No question.
is-not-question.eg: E.g. Does beta alanine improve exercise performance?

can-not-synthesize.title: Nuance required.
can-not-synthesize.desc: Our models detected a potentially complicated question and are not yet accurate enough to provide a definitive answer. We are working to handle this in the future, but for now, please try another question.

question-summary.try-question-desc: To unlock the synthesis features, ask a simple research question.
question-summary.try-synthesize-desc: Enable to have our AI read several papers and synthesize the findings

limit.title: Sorry, too much traffic.
limit.desc: Generative tasks are expensive, and we are experiencing a spike in requests. Please give us some time to get this feature back online.

feature-limit.title: Oops!
feature-limit.desc: You have used all of your free GPT-4 Summaries for the month.

question-summary.error-desc: The Summary is still in Beta, so this may happen occasionally. Please try refreshing the page. If this doesn't work, try again later.

enterprise-features: Share bookmarks and lists with your team

ai-credits-tooltip.title: Free AI Credits
ai-credits-tooltip.description: AI Credits are needed for our most expensive AI models, like the GPT-4 Summary and the Consensus Meter

quartile.title: SJR Quartile
quartile.description: measures the influence of journals within a domain. Scores are divided into quartiles, with Q1 being the most influential and Q4 being the least.
quartile.we-could-not-map: We could not map this paper to a journal with an SJR score. If you think this is a mistake, please let us know
